description: I have added a parameter to the plot window class _rh that tracks if users want to have the "east" direction on their plot to default so that it sets up a right handed coordinate system with the normal vector and north vector (user defined or implicitly defined in axis slice plots), such that the cross product of the east vector and normal vector is in the direction of the north vector. This value defaults to true. Setting it to false flips the frb  horizontally about its central column, which is mathematically equivalent to multiplying the normal vector by -1, but functionally is much more robust about doing it. I am trying to write tests, but I am relatively unfamiliar with the test modules, and need assistance.
title: Enabling right-handed coordinate systems to be toggled: solving Issue #1231

content.raw:
You just need to increment the answer number in the tests.yaml file. I'd update your pull request, see which tests fail, then update the YAML file.

See: http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/developing/testing.html#enabling-answer-tests-on-jenkins

pullrequest.title: Enabling right-handed coordinate systems to be toggled: solving Issue #1231

content.raw:
Looking at the docs build, I noticed that the tick marks along the x axis were still the same. This will be wrong (especially if somone chooses origin='domain'). Unfortunately you can't switch extent[0] and extent[1] because it turns our extents must be monotonically increasing.

Instead I found a better workaround. Here's the diff:

```
diff -r 9491feda8c1e yt/visualization/plot_window.py
--- a/yt/visualization/plot_window.py   Thu Aug 04 16:59:43 2016 -0500
+++ b/yt/visualization/plot_window.py   Thu Aug 04 18:50:23 2016 -0500
@@ -806,15 +806,15 @@ class PWViewerMPL(PlotWindow):
                 ia = ImageArray(ia)
             else:
                 ia = image
-            if not self._right_handed:
-                ia = np.fliplr(ia)
             self.plots[f] = WindowPlotMPL(
                 ia, self._field_transform[f].name,
                 self._field_transform[f].func,
                 self._colormaps[f], extent, zlim,
                 self.figure_size, font_size,
                 self.aspect, fig, axes, cax)
-
+            if not self._right_handed:
+                ax = self.plots[f].axes
+                ax.invert_xaxis()
             axes_unit_labels = ['', '']
             comoving = False
             hinv = False
```

This makes the tick marks along the x-axis decrease in the example you added to the docs.
content.html:
Looking at the docs build, I noticed that the tick marks along the x axis were still the same. This will be wrong (especially if somone chooses origin='domain'). Unfortunately you can't switch extent[0] and extent[1] because it turns our extents must be monotonically increasing.

Instead I found a better workaround. Here's the diff:

diff -r 9491feda8c1e yt/visualization/plot_window.py
--- a/yt/visualization/plot_window.py   Thu Aug 04 16:59:43 2016 -0500
+++ b/yt/visualization/plot_window.py   Thu Aug 04 18:50:23 2016 -0500
@@ -806,15 +806,15 @@ class PWViewerMPL(PlotWindow):
                 ia = ImageArray(ia)
             else:
                 ia = image
-            if not self._right_handed:
-                ia = np.fliplr(ia)
             self.plots[f] = WindowPlotMPL(
                 ia, self._field_transform[f].name,
                 self._field_transform[f].func,
                 self._colormaps[f], extent, zlim,
                 self.figure_size, font_size,
                 self.aspect, fig, axes, cax)
-
+            if not self._right_handed:
+                ax = self.plots[f].axes
+                ax.invert_xaxis()
             axes_unit_labels = ['', '']
             comoving = False
             hinv = False

This makes the tick marks along the x-axis decrease in the example you added to the docs.
